question.title: Android .idea/misc.xml's languageLevel tag keeps changing JDKs
question.body:
The languageLevel key gets changed from JDK_1_8 to JDK_1_7 for reasons I am not aware.

What could be going on?

Does this have something to do with the IDE of other developers working on the project? Maybe they have another Android Studio setting?

Here is what pops up after I notice files under source control have changed:

$ git diff
diff --git a/.idea/misc.xml b/.idea/misc.xml
index fbb6828..5d19981 100644
--- a/.idea/misc.xml
+++ b/.idea/misc.xml
@@ -37,7 +37,7 @@
     <ConfirmationsSetting value="0" id="Add" />
     <ConfirmationsSetting value="0" id="Remove" />
   </component>
-  <component name="ProjectRootManager" version="2" languageLevel="JDK_1_8" default="true" assert-keyword="true" jdk-15="true" project-jdk-name="1.8" project-jdk-type="JavaSDK">
+  <component name="ProjectRootManager" version="2" languageLevel="JDK_1_7" default="true" assert-keyword="true" jdk-15="true" project-jdk-name="1.8" project-jdk-type="JavaSDK">
     <output url="file://$PROJECT_DIR$/build/classes" />
   </component>
   <component name="ProjectType">

This is my gitignore in case it matters.

.gradle
/local.properties
/.idea/workspace.xml
/.idea/libraries
.DS_Store
/build
/captures

How do I proceed so that it just stays one way or the other?

answers.body:
Faced this issue today and wanted to share what fixed it for me at least.

Seems after updating Android Studio the Gradle JDK within settings had changed to JDK 21, which led to the misc.xml being updated each time I tried to build the app.

Changed it back to JDK 17, the JDK being used, and the issue resolved itself.

The following is how I got to the setting from the screenshot.

  1. File > Settings

  2. Build, Execution, Deployment > Build Tools > Gradle

  3. Gradle JDK:
